intro: Uraria clarkei, commonly known as the narrow-leaf uraria, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with slender stems and trifoliate leaves. Its small, yellowish-white flowers appear in racemes and are followed by flat, pod-like fruits. Uraria clarkei is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
